data.title: Elegant atmosphere, excellent food
data.text: This is a lovely restaurant with an extensive menu.  The service is exquisite, the food delicious and beautifully presented. Great wine list too.  A little bit of Europe in New Haven.

data.title: Outstanding!
data.text: If you're looking for the ultimate in food and service, this is the place.  The food and service are outstanding!

data.title: A League of their Own
data.text:
Amazing food.  Helpful staff.  Elegant atmosphere.  Union League Cafe is in a league of its own.
Ask for a table near the fireplace for a romantic evening.

data.title: The art of fine dining
data.text: This is a high end French restaurant.  Very fine cuisine, Restaurant is neat with very professional Staff.  Please visit this restaurant when in New Haven.

data.title: Upscale dining even... if .one is weighing in for faboulous
data.text: Posh, sophisticated, dinning .  Ambience is old world enchanting and so are their expertly trained staff, a par on their own.  A place to relax and dine with ease and expectations that meet the menu's descriptions.  My only suggestion is easy up on the white truffle oil.  although it it is considered an aphrodia...(. to many...). it's not for  all of us mere humans.  Bon Appetit... the Union League Cafe is a team that deserves a pendant.  Well done... BRAVO

data.title: Traditional but good
data.text: I gave this 5 stars because what they do they do well. It is very traditional French. The space and decor is beautiful. That all being said I wish they were a bit more innovative with their menu and perhaps had more exciting specials. It's still good but set your expectations.

data.title: A lovely way to celebrate a 50th class reunion
data.text:
Every Yale Law School class reunion includes a class dinner on Saturday night. YLS reserves the Union League Cafe for the class clebrating its 50th reunion.  After our celebration, I wish every reunion could be our 50th.

The food is indescribably good.  I had the vegetarian entree: a macaroni dish with some exotic mushroom.  It had such wonderful flavor, I did not miss having meat.  The appetizers served during the reception were original and delicous.  If you want to feel special, this is the place.

data.title: Very elegant dining
data.text: This restaurant has a wonderful atmosphere - very sophisticated and charming. The service was excellent, the wine list impressive and the food was superb. Highly recommended for a special occasion.

data.title: knights of columbus board meeting
data.text: We were there as a group of 35 people.  The restaurant has a great atmosphere and it has a great history.  The food was prepared for a large group.  However, the food was excellent.  The salad was very good if you like a salad of mixed greens.  I am not much of these types of salads, but it was very tasty.  The dinner was a NY steak dinner.  Although I do not like steaks covered in gravy, the meat was cooked as ordered.  Overall good food and great atmosphere.

data.title: EXCELLENT in every way
data.text: The food was outstanding. We loved every course. The wine list is exceptional. The staff is very attentive and detail oriented. We LOVED this restaurant. The Grand Marnier souffle is a MUST HAVE. We will definitely be going back.

data.title: Memorable birthday
data.text:
My husband wonderfully surprised me with a night out at this historic New Haven eatery. Parking same as theater district is validated. The ambiance felt like a NYC equivalent restaurant with close, lined single tables. (Not super romantic or private but the food outweighs all and makes everyone else disappear!). The feel is Old charm with lower ceilings, narrow aisle, and antique furnishings blended with modern art.  Interestingly dish serving-ware and the cocktail serving-ware was plain -  plastic stirrers, fake table candle, plain white plates, and no copper cup for the mule.  Service was excellent with multiple attendees and great balance of attention and pleasant efficiency. 
The meal was fabulous - my husband loved the octopus appetizer cooked perfect (but portion-wise would have loved 1 more leg) and my steak app was tasty. Cheese sampler was ok. We asked to be surprised and try new cheeses we may have not experienced. What was brought was not impressive for a French Restaurant - just similar to cheddar and Brie. No wow factor. My main meal changed that tho. The red pepper crusted lamb with veggies was fabulous. Unique flavor and prep is indescribable. Just what you want in trying something new. My husband had the yellow fin tuna. He gave it a thumbs up along with the lava cake and ending espresso.  I had an Argentinian coffee at the end which again was unique and memorable. Paired with Feuillantine Au Chocolat Et Noisettes, a blend of my fave sweet desserts: chocolate, hazelnut, and caramel. Summary: Service 5.  Food 5. Ambiance 4. We'd go back and catch a show next time. TAPS.

data.title: Exceeded Expectations 😊
data.text: Fine French dining with superb service. I took my wife here earlier this week for her birthday and we loved it. Great service and even better food. Atmosphere was perfect too. Waiter was clearly an expert and made the experience that much better. Can't hardly wait to try something else on the menu...

data.title: Fine French Cuisine
data.text: An inventive menu with a good range of options, fine setting (perhaps a bit too formal for my tastes), for me the star of the show was the special selection of wines by the glass. Attentive waiting staff too.

data.title: Wonderful dinner following the birth of our grandson!
data.text: We headed over the Union League following a day at Yale-New Haven hospital to celebrate the birth of our new grandson.  We had wonderful wine and food with a toast to the baby and new Mom and Dad with a lovely Beaujolais!  The food was delicious and the staff was attentive and gracious.   It was truly a special occasion for both sets of grandparents.  The staff packed up a complete take out dinner for the new parents that we delivered to the hospital, they were delighted.

data.title: Great find on a ride home!
data.text: Found this place while driving back from New Hampshire; at first was afraid to go in thought I was under dressed. Then a couple walked in ahead of us in shorts and realized I was fine. Thank goodness because what we experienced inside was nothing short of excellence! Oysters fresh and clean, mignonette excellent shrimp cocktail delicious. Hanger steak was cooked perfectly the scallops oh my God! Dessert looked mouthwatering but had dinner reservations at home did not want to spoil appetite. Recommend this to all !!!!!!! Will return with a healthy appetite

data.title: A Classy Place
data.text:
This French Cuisine Restaurant is one of a kind, very classy and with a great ambient. I should rate it 5 but ends up rating it 4 because a few flaws.
The first is the fact it doesn’t have parking of its own, nor a parking valet either. (management, think on that last one). 
The second is there are not a clear reception area, the entrance is awkward and make you feel embarrassed thinking you enter on the wrong way.
As you step in, you face the back of a long counter, where there is food ready to be served, so you thing “OMG I’m entering through the waitress station”, but there is a Host in the far right end of such counter, however you face it by the side, reinforcing the feeling you got there wrong somehow. I talk the Host about and she told me, that I wasn’t wrong. 
The third is the menu, most of the options are fish, and or contain fish only. There is one lamb, one beef and one chicken. The only pasta contain fish too.
However, there is a nice selection of “no fish “, (I was thrilled) soups and salads. A delicious and wide choices of artisanal cheeses are available for appetizers or dessert.
The desserts (all homemade) are sublime. Wine selection is very good and wide (did not expect anything less from a French Restaurant). There is a full bar to provide you excellent drinks.
The attention is really exceptional; the waitress is totally pending on you. Bread and butter is served magically any time that your bread basket gets empty.
Dishes are served absolutely perfect. It is gourmet grade food made to you on demand from scratch. Because of it be aware and allow some extra time for the kitchen to
prepare your orders.

data.title: Expensive but worth It for a special occasion!
data.text:
This is billed as one of the best restaurants in New Haven and it certainly lived up to its reputation. On the whole delicious food beautifully served in this old style historic building.
Only one disappointment was the Arctic Char "special" which was an overcooked piece of fish and not very tasty.
That being said everything else was excellent and our server made the evening.

data.title: Lovely atmosphere
data.text: Excellent as a special event sort of dinner place. Attentive staff, historic surroundings. Drips with atmosphere. Good quality seafood, well cooked. I am not going to forget it any time soon!

data.title: The best in New Haven!
data.text: Union league Cafe is outstanding!  The waitstaff was amazing they were very knowledgeable about the menu and the wine list.  Our waiter took his time explaining everything we had asked him and he gave us some very good suggestions!  The mussels in the curry broth were amazing!  The lamb mad filet mignon were also really good and our wine selection was great!  Don't forget about dessert A+++ can't wait to back for our next special occasion.

data.title: 10 best meals ever
data.text:
This was one of the best meals ever! The attention to detail in presentation was incredible. The service by Nigel our server was beyond professional. He was attentive but not overbearing. We were a party of 8 and he took care of each of us as though serving a party of two. They were very busy but you didn't feel rushed meal very well paced. We had the royal tower of seafood to begin and then ordered dinner. The escargot were excellent along with the local seviche and the duck confit and Roquefort salad fantastic. We had arctic char also lamb and gnocchi French style. Some of us ordered grand marnier souffle which was to die for. I had the petit fours hand made just wonderful. If you want someplace extraordinary this is your place! 

E
